moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 exd4 4. Nxd4 c5: by this time, my opponent got abusive: he was going to learn me a strong lesson; that is the friendly translation...
moves.14... bxc3 15. Bxc3 Qc7: losing more tempo: White is a full light piece ahead...
moves.16. Re1 Bd7: preparing castling long: right into trouble...
moves.17. Ne5 O-O-O: hoping for an attack, on the White Queen...
moves.19... Kb8 20. Be5: pinning the Black Queen unto the King: Be5 has to be taken...
moves.20... Nxe5 21. Nxe5: White is still winning the trade: the real threat is Qb3+, whatever happens...
moves.22... Qxb3 23. axb3 Bf6 24. f4: also Nxe7+, Rxe7, Rxe8+, was an option: this closes the deal...
moves.24... Ka7 25. Bc4+: in this position, Black timed out: he is running mate...

gameName: fiercequeen dealing out justice (part 2 and final)...
